text:
- [Instructor] Welcome to
the Amazon Braket Console.

Today, we're going to show
off an exciting new feature,
a dedicated service dashboard.
This new dashboard is designed
to give you an overview of your account,
as well as quick actions
that can help you find relevant resources,

such as links to our
example Jupyter notebooks,
and our Python SDK.

The dashboard allows you to
customize the layout by dragging

and dropping widgets in
the order that you prefer.

You can also remove widgets
that no longer interest you
from that widgets context menu.
You can always re-add widgets
by going to our widget gallery.
Here, select the widgets that you prefer,

click Add, and they'll
appear at the bottom
of your dashboard.

Some widgets, such as
our recent jobs widget,

provides additional context
to help you get started
with that feature of brackets,
including links to external information
and developer guides.
Other widgets, such as our device widget,
allow additional configuration,
either through the dropdown context,
or if this hasn't been configured yet,

likely through some buttons
on the widget itself.
Here, for example, in our devices widget,
we can select a preferred device
where we can now show

that relevant information on
our dashboard at all times.
Finally, if you are no longer interested

in the dashboards
configuration that you've set

and you'd like to reset
it, click the Reset

to Default Layer button
to go back to the default.
We're excited to launch this new feature

and we're hoping to bring
more widgets to you soon.
